abstract: New York City officials announce changes to J'ouvert, predawn street festival for West Indian American Day Parade; hope to deter assaults that have come to plague festivities by increasing police presence putting about 200 floodlights along parade route.

headline.print_headline: In Hopes of Deterring Violence at Street Festival, Officials Turn Up the Lights
headline.main: In Hopes of Deterring Violence at J’ouvert Festival, Officials Turn Up the Lights

snippet: Officials said the event that precedes the West Indian American Day Parade in Brooklyn would be given a permit, more uniformed officers and roughly 200 floodlights....
lead_paragraph: Officials said the event that precedes the West Indian American Day Parade in Brooklyn would be given a permit, more uniformed officers and roughly 200 floodlights.
